transportAdvice: Maun is a sprawling town where walking between attractions is generally impractical due to distances and heat; taxis and hired vehicles are the primary means of getting around for tourists. Public minibus transport exists but is limited in coverage and not well-suited to tourist areas, so most visitors rely on lodge transfers, safari operators, or privately arranged taxis.

weather.description: Peak wet season with frequent afternoon thunderstorms, high heat, and lush green landscapes.
Continued heavy rainfall and humidity make this one of the wettest months of the year.
Rains begin to ease slightly but remain frequent, with warm temperatures and green bush.
Rainfall decreasing, temperatures cooling, and the landscape remains verdant and attractive.
